label: ham
subject: [R] Goodness of fit- Pareto distribution
body: 63 (return) [ The Itinerary from Bourdeaux to Jerusalem was composed in the year 333, for the use of pilgrims; among whom Jerom (tom. i. p. 126) mentions the Britons and the Indians. The causes of this superstitious fashion are discussed in the learned and judicious preface of Wesseling. (Itinarar. p. 537-545.) ÑÑMuch curious information on this subject is collected in the first chapter of Wilken, Geschichte der KreuzzŸge.ÑM.]
